snippet: The Heckscher Museum of Art is showcasing photographs by Hal Fullerton depicting landscapes, boats, workers and seashore bathers on Long Island in the late 19th and early 20th centuries.
abstract: Exhibit Scooters, Cranberry Pickers and 'Whirling Dervishes': Hal B Fullerton's Long Island, at Heckscher Museum of Art in Huntington, showcases photographs by Hal Fullerton, special agent for the Long Island Railroad in late 19th and early 20th centuries; images, depicting landscapes, boats, workers and seashore bathers on Long Island, have been painstakingly restored from glass negatives (Metropolitan/Long Island).
lead_paragraph: The Heckscher Museum of Art is showcasing photographs by Hal Fullerton depicting landscapes, boats, workers and seashore bathers on Long Island in the late 19th and early 20th centuries.

headline.seo: An Exhibition of Century-Old Long Island Photographs at the Heckscher Museum
headline.main: Crisp Images From a Faded Long Island Past
headline.print_headline: Crisp Images From a Faded Long Island Past
